channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 10cm inches wide and 6 cm deep pothole. next to my front patio. several cracks and bumps near my patio and front door, 13th July
item.description:
Tripping hazard

item.title: Dangerous bonfire causing nuance, 13th July
item.description:
A bonfire in the garden of 28-30 Walford Road, in too close proximity to the buildings and plants. It is causing a smell for the street, on a hot day when everyone has their windows open and is dangerous
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Walford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping on Macoma Terrace, in the alley next to number 2 and in Lenton Path, 13th July
item.description:
The rubbish has been here this week. The amount of the fly tipping in the alley next to 2 Macoma Terrace has increased over the week. There is a bed on Lenton Path which is opposite the end of Macoma Terrace.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Macoma Terrace, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox found, 13th July
item.description:
Dead fox found next to bollard crossing. Location is on the east side of the junction between Foxgrove Road and Westgate Road. Location is near 83 Foxgrove Road. Dead animal was seen at approximately 13:00 on Sunday 13 July.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxgrove Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Play area vandalised, 13th July
item.description:
The 2-person large swing on the wooden post has been completely broken. This is about the only decent play item in this park, so is a massive loss to the children. Please see attached photos. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Gate Drive, Falconwood, London

item.title: Continual flytipping not resolved, 13th July
item.description:
Hello, this issue is still ongoing and has been closed with no collection. People are now adding more, could this please be resolved asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-6, Salisbury Close, Walworth, London

item.title: Ambiguous road markings / crossing?, 13th July
item.description:
There has been recent work to change the road layout which seems to have been left unfinished. Firstly the new layout is dangerous for cyclists due to narrowing carriageway with no discernible benefit to pedestrians. Secondly the state the road is in currently from a drivers perspective it doesnâ€™t look like a crossing, and from a pedestrians perspective it does look like a crossing. I think this is very dangerous, and given the location next to a primary school it should be fixed quickly before there is an incident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Close, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Collingwood Close, Anerley, London
